alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued November 13 at 3:27AM PST until November 13 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility of a quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of the Rogue Valley including Medford, Ashland, Phoenix, Talent, Gold Hill, and Rogue River. This also includes portions of Interstate 5. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As of 3:30 AM, the Dense Fog is mainly at Central Point and Medford, but will likely spread to the remainder of the valley around sunrise. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow for plenty of room between you and other vehicles. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are * Use low beams. High beams reflect back thick fog, making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Be prepared. Keep your headlights clean. That way, you`re ready for low-visibility conditions * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.
